body: Please learn ElasticSearch template first. You are not following the context. At least understanding what we are saying, then reply, rather than repeating your own words.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6262851/135234456-50433f20-b147-4ca9-9885-0f6d3aa9f162.png)
Is it normal for you to generate such a URL?
As far as I know, yes. This is a template name. Why are you keeping asking me same thing?

Because it is impossible to find things in es, an error was reported directly
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6262851/135235414-e395f6c5-39ae-4117-967f-5b04f0ddaae3.png)
That is exactly why I ask you to check what is specially for you ElasticSearch. Why does template do not work at your side.

> That is exactly why I ask you to check what is specially for you ElasticSearch. Why does template do not work at your side.

so, may be the reason of es, I will study this

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6262851/135245615-e3f3e0e5-7822-4745-830a-6cff5e8a16a4.png)
I think I know, you used alias search first, and some of the indexes created did not have aliases.
All indices should have an alias, because we used `prefix` match.

I think it may be the problem of k8s. K8s has been deployed with multiple historical versions. It may be caused by some cached jar packages. After I initialized the index of es with the tar package directly on the machine, it can run normally.

Hi @offSwitch , thanks for reporting, I've created a pull request to fix this, but before the 8.9.0 release, you can compile the `zipkin-receiver-plugin` module and download `zipkin2` related dependencies, then put them into the `oap-libs` directory.

If this has `.exe` suffix, then we need to be careful about dealing with `skywalking-eyes` checking or others in ASF doing check for our release. This could be identified as binary file, which is not allowed in the ASF source release. Meanwhile, according to your description, this should have a very clear document about what this exe is.

And for more importantly, does this enough for Windows? We have `swtcl`(having Windows binary, but set up Linux's binary only) and many other scripts, are they working too?

The reason I asked about is that, once we say something in the doc, these `a/b/c` are for Windows, we actually are saying, we are going to support `infra-e2e` in Windows, and users even expect the consistent setting for Windows and MacOS/Linux.

> If this has `.exe` suffix, then we need to be careful about dealing with `skywalking-eyes` checking or others in ASF doing check for our release. This could be identified as binary file, which is not allowed in the ASF source release. Meanwhile, according to your description, this should have a very clear document about what this exe is.

`.exe` is definitely binary file, and it is only distributed in binary tar, not source tar.

This issue is just to add a suffix `.exe` to the binary files, which were already distributed but not work because of lack of `.exe`.

> And for more importantly, does this enough for Windows? We have swtcl(having Windows binary, but set up Linux's binary only) and many other scripts, are they working too?

> The reason I asked about is that, once we say something in the doc, these a/b/c are for Windows, we actually are saying, we are going to support infra-e2e in Windows, and users even expect the consistent setting for Windows and MacOS/Linux.

For `license-eye` it should be supported in Windows, but for `infra-e2e` it depends on how the users compose the control file, I'll just remove the label `infra-e2e`.

> This issue is just to add a suffix .exe to the binary files, which were already distributed but not work because of lack of .exe.

Once it could be generated/compiled and located in binary tar only, it is good.

Let's hold PR this a little bit, I've found some misuses of the verifier rules that affect the accuracy of the E2E and I am fixing, let's wait for the patch and there are some misuses in this PR that need adjustments.

If anything is going to happen on dotnet, it is out of ASF scope. That project belongs to SkyAPM community from legal perspective.
We discussed this topic, which is similar with Zipkin. We can't see the chance to analyze metrics and topology from its traces too.
If you transfer trace format from their sides, and follow SkyWalking trace format, we don't need to open new receiver.

Just fix the wrong rules, there are something need to check:

- [ ] why the 2 cases trigger the same endpoint but the expected topology are different

> Just fix the wrong rules, there are something need to check:
> 
> * [ ]  why the 2 cases trigger the same endpoint but the expected topology are different

I think the returned data is not in order, the input `serviceID` here could be different each time？

```
- query: swctl --display yaml --base-url=http://${oap_host}:${oap_12800}/graphql dependency service $(swctl --display yaml --base-url=http://${oap_host}:${oap_12800}/graphql service ls|grep -B 1 'provider'|yq e '.[0].id' -)
```
All metadata query results are not in order. You should either do name grep filter or encode name by yourself rather than depending on metadata query.

> If you transfer trace format from their sides, and follow SkyWalking trace format, we don't need to open new receiver.

Tks, can you provide some compare table about semantics and  name/value spec between skywalking and open telemetry?

I can only inspire by node implement now, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/blob/master/src/agent/protocol/grpc/SegmentObjectAdapter.ts

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nodejs/blob/master/src/agent/protocol/grpc/clients/TraceReportClient.ts
You don't provide enough message to indi the status.

I need these information to do:
1. Extract for income
2. Inject for outcome
3. Export implement

This is SkyWalking protocol, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/protocols/readme/#language-based-native-agent-protocol

Sorry, we don't have such table to match, due to we don't support this.

Ok, tks, I will try later

Maybe dotnet implement can give some more inspire

https://github.com/SkyAPM/SkyAPM-dotnet/blob/master/src/SkyApm.Core/Tracing/CarrierPropagator.cs

Btw, a basic idea  Just for reference if some other one need:
1. Use http api to do trace push for quick start, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/protocols/http-api-protocol/ , use bulk mode for performance
2. A new propagator base on https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet/blob/main/src/OpenTelemetry.Api/Context/Propagation/B3Propagator.cs
3. a new exporter base on https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet/blob/main/src/OpenTelemetry.Exporter.Zipkin/ZipkinExporter.cs

我的项目使用了vertx+jersey，jersey作为表现层的接口框架，通过提供类似Spring的注解来表达URI。例如@path，@get，@post等。我集成skywalking的agent之后，能发现这个service，但是不能发现endpoint，所以我怀疑是skywalking不支持jersey，因为我另外一个项目纯使用vertx web是没问题的。如果skywalking真不支持jersey，请问开发支持jersey的插件有流程文档吗？

All official discussion of SkyWalking must be in English. We have provided QQ groups for Chinese discussion channel.
All plugins of SkyWalking are contributed by the community.
The go2sky case keeps failure. Strange, we don't use e2e for it yet.

`Cross Process Propagation Headers Protocol v3` and `SkyWalking Trace Data Protocol v3` are required if you just set up a MVP. Others are recommended due to SkyWalking's other agents, especially Java, implemented all of them.
Ok, tks
Could you be clear what is the change? This seems a breaking change for existing cases.

MAL engine doesn't care what labels are from where.
Such as Prometheus fetcher could add target as labels in default. OpenCensus receiver and Envoy metrics service handler, also LAL generated metrics don't have the idea of sources. 
Please be clear about your cases.

@kezhenxu94 Hi, I would like to take this up, can you please assign it to me? Since I am new to the project, can you also please give a bit more context about the task, and the files which I should start looking at?

Yes, this is still open. 
You first should understand how Java agent works, and tracing basic idea(Google dapper paper).
After that, plugin development and testing docs, and take a reference from existing Tomcat 8 plugin.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/tree/main/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/tomcat-7.x-8.x-plugin

This is the latest.

> @kezhenxu94 Hi, I would like to take this up, can you please assign it to me? Since I am new to the project, can you also please give a bit more context about the task, and the files which I should start looking at?
> 
> 

Hi @deepto98 , thanks for the interest, the rationale behind this task is that, for containerized scenarios, the style of `agent.instance_properties[xxx]=xxx` is hard (if not impossible) to modify, using json style like `agent.instance_properties_json={xxx:yyy}`, the users can modify via environment variables.
It is not a good approach to resolve my issue so that I l closed it
Ready to merge now
Are you going to submit a pull request?

> Are you going to submit a pull request?

yes，the plugin in my project has already worked, now i am reading to submit a pull request
Sure, make sure you follow the plugin dev and test doc.
We don't expect that, from design perspective. Any SRE or Ops team is impossible to identify issue from one specific instance/pod.
Move to discussion.
Welcome to submit a pull request to fix and add a new UT to cover new case.
@wu-sheng Hi, most of the failed checks are due to the failure of container startup. Where can I see the reasons for the failure?
You could start locally. I assume you change yaml file incorrect. Where is server definition?

Hi @chzhuo thanks for reporting! First of all, failing to install a plugin does no harm if you're not using that library, but your demo application `index.js` is also meaningless and it exits immediately even if the mysql2 plugin succeeded to install because you don't have any real server running.
@xuanyuanaosheng @kezhenxu94 I also encountered the same problem, oap:8.5.0,how did you solve the problem?

I get the same error log in an online app that connects the Mysql server by `mysql2`, so I use this demo to reproduce this error.  
I think mysql2-plugin did not work well when getting this error log.

> I get the same error log in an online app that connects the Mysql server by `mysql2`, so I use this demo to reproduce this error.
> I think mysql2-plugin did not work well when getting this error log.

Yes, `mysql2-plugin` breaks after `mysql2` uses the `exports` in `package.json`, we need to adjust our plugin due to this.

You didn't fill the title.
The length control about names of service, instance and endpoint was not working for logs.
It has been fixed in 8.8.0. Use 8.8.1 please.
Submit issue after you tried the latest version or have read change loga.

> the

@wu-sheng  follow the test doc，i stuck in scenario test，the mock collector in the docker container can not receview data, but local(depoly mock collector can get data from agent) is ok，the agent config backend_service is 127.0.0.1:11800 or 127.0.0.1:19876 in mock collector doc, or other?
There are hundreds of cases there, have you tried them?

> There are hundreds of cases there, have you tried them?

i find the problem, the entryService is very slow，but the test curl set time out 3s，when curl time out and then get receive data from mock collector，the entryService still not end， so the segments is null
Make your test service as fast as possible. We have limited resources for CI, but we have to test all plugins in most changes.
This makes sense, are you or someone going to contribute this?
@gxthrj Please take a look.
I noticed this from several PRs about adding component IDs.
Good proposal. I can see we copied these repeatedly already.
You also miss the changes.md in the root.
BTW `include` should be a list, right? We may need to split the verification into different files for reuse.

I think it makes sense to me.

sorry, i change this like other passed pr which only add component define, it looks some pr not add changes.md. hh, already ci
FYI @wankai123

> BTW `include` should be a list, right? We may need to split the verification into different files for reuse.

Not necessarily, `include` can occur multiple times, so you can combine as many files as you want, reason is here https://github.com/apache/skywalking-infra-e2e/pull/53#discussion_r725780195
I and @gxthrj will do this next month(maybe). If anyone is interesting, can assign him.
PR is https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/pull/45.

> We can access to the original parameters and their types are known, so the part typeA-> seems verbose to me. Can we use something like typeB(Xxx) like long(Service.tag["latency"])? In this case long() can be a plain function instead of a special new syntax.

You could take a look at how we do compiling for OAL, then you will realize why we don't have type check in the generation process. This is not a special case for this feature, it exists from beginning.

If we implement `long(xxx)`, the biggest challenge will be, we have to know the target type through attribute expression. But we never tried to do that. 
What you are asking, is a typical static type compiler doing. It makes sense, but we don't have the core(mostly compiling context) to do that.
please take a look at `metrics-has-value-percentile.yml` @kezhenxu94

> please take a look at `metrics-has-value-percentil.yml` @kezhenxu94

`percentil` -> `percentile`

@kezhenxu94 I moved the cast statement before the expression and fields. Also provided `(long)` and `(int)` as short versions of `(str->long)` and `(str->int)`. But still, we don't check the type of field(neither do type prediction) until compiling through java assist
I did a simple test comparison and it looks like Disruptor does serve our purpose, I will provide the full JMH Test shortly.

> I did a simple test comparison and it looks like Disruptor does serve our purpose, I will provide the full JMH Test shortly.

Disruptor has better performance for sure. We have tested years ago. The challenge is thread-model. We are not using one thread per logic queue, because we created one logic queue per metrics, which could be changed and keep increasing.
No, we are not a BI system.

> > I did a simple test comparison and it looks like Disruptor does serve our purpose, I will provide the full JMH Test shortly.
> 
> Disruptor has better performance for sure. We have tested years ago. The challenge is thread-model. We are not using one thread per logic queue, because we created one logic queue per metrics, which could be changed and keep increasing.

Yes, this is a clever design by Channel,

For Disruptor, at present, I can only think of providing a more flexible configuration to achieve an ideal effect.
What module? Do you mean maven module?

> What module? Do you mean maven module?

Like this.

https://github.com/netty/netty/tree/4.1/microbench

https://github.com/netty/netty/tree/4.1/microbench/src/main/java/io/netty/microbench/util

We can provide some basic JMH classes so that writing the JMH Test can be much easier.
I think SkyWalking has `server-testing` maven module to host base codes for testing. If you want to add and reflect something, welcome to submit pull requests.

> I think SkyWalking has `server-testing` maven module to host base codes for testing. If you want to add and reflect something, welcome to submit pull requests.

well, thanks a lot. I will submit PR
All issues should have good title and reported in English.
Yes, this field is planned to be added, and a lot of plugins require this field to provide high performance. That is one of many reasons of SkyWalking agent having such good performance
The question we want to ask is, why do you want to enhance a serializable class?

> 
> 
> The question we want to ask is, why do you want to enhance a serializable class?

This problem occurs because we have a single sign on and redis shared session, which are the default sequence mechanism for spring security operations

deserialize payload. Is the byte array a result of corresponding serialization for DefaultDeserializer?; nested exception is java.io.InvalidClassException: org.springframework.aop.framework.DefaultAopProxyFactory; local class incompatible: stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 7930414337282325166, local class serialVersionUID = 7250238719487042907
	at org.springframework.data.redis.serializer.JdkSerializationRedisSerializer.deserialize(JdkSerializationRedisSerializer.java:84)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.core.AbstractOperations.deserializeHashValue(AbstractOperations.java:354)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.core.AbstractOperations.deserializeHashMap(AbstractOperations.java:298)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.core.DefaultHashOperations.entries(DefaultHashOperations.java:233)
	at org.springframework.data.redis.core.DefaultBoundHashOperations.entries(DefaultBoundHashOperations.java:172)
	at org.springframework.session.data.redis.RedisOperationsSessionRepository.getSession(RedisOperationsSessionRepository.java:466)
	at org.springframework.session.data.redis.RedisOperationsSessionRepository.findById(RedisOperationsSessionRepository.java:435)
	at org.springframework.session.data.redis.RedisOperationsSessionRepository.findById(RedisOperationsSessionRepository.java:247)
Then, the same question, why enhancing this class? We don't enhance this in default.
Duplicate #7915

At present, spring security should serialize this class to redis. We directly join skywalking through javaagent without other special operations. At present, because the additional field of agent affects suid calculation, we can only deal with spring security?
I don't understand what you are saying. You could an object into Redis or Spring or anything, SkyWalking don't manipulate it in default. SkyWalking is targeting specific classes for tracing only.

> At present, spring security should serialize this class to redis. 

`DefaultAopProxyFactory` in serialization is the thing we don't know why, I think. 

I did a quick search in the codes, `apm-spring-core-patch` plugin enhanced this, because there is conflicts happening between Spring internal mechanism and SkyWalking's agent.

My question will be, why put this in the streaming? I think this is a code abuse?
`DefaultAopProxyFactory` has no field, just several methods, why do you put this in serialization process?

Sorry, it's translated in English by software. I want to explain that this defaultaopproxyfactory is saved by spring security after the user logs in. I didn't do this. When I request an address, it will be intercepted by spring security and go to redis to obtain the user information. Can it be solved only through spring security 。
（抱歉，英文使用软件翻译的，我的意思想说明，这个DefaultAopProxyFactory是spring security在用户登录之后保存的，我没有做这个事情，当我请求一个地址的时候，会被spring security拦截，前往redis获取用户信息反序列化出现的，是不是只能通过spring security解决）
We don't have mechanism to skip adding this field, because enhanced object in interceptor requires this.
I could consider adding a weak instrumentation for this, but we don't have it for now.
Press enter after input.
Or if you are using ElasticSearch, it bases on words analyzing.
